KLS goes green is a campaign I am gladly telling you more about because it is a great project.
It came into existence because many students at my school are interestetinterested in climate crisis and things that we can do as individuals to combat the disaster.

In my last e-mail I told you about Fridays for Futures but now my school wants to do some thing itself to show their interest in a sustainable lifestyle and that's why teachers, students and parents brought the project KLS goes green into life.
This is a project for several days which consists of many different workshops that all have to do something with climate change and environmental protection.
Let me give you a little insight what these workshops are about:
For example students learn about the right use of water, energy and food.
A group of people did a workshop about food sharing others made a secondhand flea market with old clothes they brought from home.
Also there was a fairtrade-coffeeshop where students selled fair traded and vegan products to show that this lifestyle possible and not that difficult as it seems to many people.
There also were some creative workshops where students could create things by themselfsthemselves to the topic environmental protection.
All in all the project was really successfullsuccessful and as far as I see everyone learn something new and start to change some things more in their daily life to reduce environmental pollution.
The learning was combined with a lot of fun which is what makes it that successfullsuccessful.
We definitlydefinitely want to repeat the project KLS goes green next year and include new ideas and workshops.
